decks.notes: This UR Aggro deck aims to quickly play aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, supported by a suite of efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Daze and Force of Will to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler can quickly grow in power, while cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card advantage and control elements. Wasteland is included to disrupt opposing nonbasic lands, further increasing the deck's aggressive tempo.

The deck focuses on utilizing Mystic Forge and various artifacts to generate a powerful combo that allows for explosive plays and overwhelming board presence. By assembling the right pieces, such as The One Ring and Glaring Fleshraker, the deck can quickly dominate the game. Karn, the Great Creator and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain provide additional support and utility for the combo. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its key pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combination of cards and abilities.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently mill through your entire library in order to win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. By utilizing a combination of fast mana, disruption, and powerful combo pieces like Undercity Informer and Balustrade Spy, the deck aims to assemble the win condition as quickly as possible while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Memory's Journey and Poxwalkers also provide additional utility and resilience to the deck's overall strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will. The deck also uses cards like Mishra's Bauble and Brainstorm to manipulate the top of the library and generate card advantage. With a mix of aggressive creatures, efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt, and disruptive counterspells, this deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent early and maintain control of the game throughout.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The deck uses cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to control the board, while also utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for key pieces. Leyline Binding and Quantum Riddler help to disrupt opponent's strategies, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides additional card advantage. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath serves as a powerful threat and provides additional card advantage. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal to cast Omniscience and cheat out big creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier with Show and Tell. It also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce for protection, as well as cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder for card selection. Cunning Wish provides additional versatility by allowing access to a sideboard of instant-speed spells, giving the deck the ability to adapt to various situations and disrupt opponents' game plans.

The deck focuses on quickly milling your entire library to win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Jack-o'-Lantern. It uses a combination of mana acceleration spells, creature sacrifice effects, and graveyard recursion to rapidly fill the graveyard and set up the win condition. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Duress and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and Pact of Negation for additional protection. The goal is to execute the combo as quickly as possible while disrupting your opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bringing them back into play for a combo finish. It uses cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead to cheat big creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play early in the game. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo from opponent's interference. Tainted Indulgence helps to filter through the deck for key combo pieces while cards like Brazen Borrower provide additional utility and tempo advantage.

The deck focuses on land control and utilizing lands to gain advantage over the opponent. It includes cards like Exploration, Crop Rotation, and Life from the Loam to quickly ramp up lands and activate powerful abilities. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter, while also establishing a strong board presence with cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. By manipulating lands and utilizing cards like Punishing Fire, the deck looks to outvalue the opponent and control the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's plays through countermagic, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Magus of the Moon. Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card advantage and disruption, while Thundertrap Trainer and Flame of Anor can close out the game quickly once the opponent's resources are depleted. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy, control the board, and eventually win through incremental advantage and powerful threats. Additionally, the deck includes versatile cards like Prismatic Ending and Snapcaster Mage for flexibility in dealing with various threats.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently ramp up mana using Cloudposts and Urza's Towers, while utilizing Karn, the Great Creator to shut down opponents' artifacts and search for key cards. The deck also focuses on disruption and control with counterspells like Force of Will, removal spells like Dismember, and card draw/filtering tools like Glimmerpost and Stock Up. The end goal is to set up a powerful board state with big mana threats like Ugin, Eye of the Storms and disrupt opponents' plans with cards like Planar Nexus and Thundertrap Trainer.

The deck aims to quickly assemble a combo involving sacrificing Undercity Informer to mill the entire library, then use Dread Return to bring back Thassa's Oracle for an immediate win. The deck includes various ways to accelerate mana production, protect the combo with Pact of Negation, and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize. The strategy revolves around executing the combo as quickly and efficiently as possible before the opponent can set up their own game-winning plays.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping into powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using the card Show and Tell. By utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Ponder, the player can set up their hand and find their combo pieces efficiently. Additionally, cards like Omniscience and Lotus Petal allow for explosive plays and the ability to cast spells for free. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo and control the game. Overall, the deck aims to cheat powerful creatures into play and overwhelm the opponent quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to use Mystic Forge in combination with cards like Manifold Key and Grim Monolith to generate infinite mana and recur powerful artifacts like Planar Nexus and Glaring Fleshraker. By utilizing cards like Ugin, the Eye of the Storms and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain, the deck aims to control the board while assembling its combo pieces. The deck also includes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Urza's Saga to search for key artifacts and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck centers around creating a powerful artifact-based combo engine to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing disruptive spells and efficient removal to control the board while quickly deploying threats to pressure the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan early with cards like Thoughtseize and Daze, while also maintaining card advantage with spells like Brainstorm and Ponder. Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf are potent threats that can quickly close out the game, supported by Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck also includes a land destruction package with Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The key concept of this Mardu Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The deck aims to apply early pressure with cards like Amped Raptor and Orcish Bowmasters while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards such as Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize. Utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to further solidify board presence and close out games. The inclusion of utility lands like Karakas and Wasteland adds additional disruption and flexibility to the deck's game plan. Overall, this deck focuses on a fast and aggressive strategy to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent.
